title: Does the Constitution allow Trump to kill the Education Department?
shortDescription: The Constitution doesn’t give President Trump the power to shutter the department on his own because it was created through legislation.

title: What does the Education Department do? What to know as Trump looks to axe it
shortDescription: Donald Trump appears to be nearing a long-touted executive order to abolish the Department of Education. Here is what the agency does for US schools.

title: House votes to censure Rep. Al Green: What does that mean?
shortDescription: A censure is considered a severe public rebuke. Here's what else to know, including examples of other censured senators and representatives.

title: President Trump agrees to one-month delay of Mexico tariffs
shortDescription: President Trump said Mexico won't be required to pay tariffs on any goods that fall under the USMCA trade agreement for the next month.

title: India's Modi agrees to US trade talks, Trump offers F-35 jets
shortDescription: In a Feb. 13, 2025, meeting at the White House with President Donald Trump, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi offered to ease India's tariffs on U.S. goods and buy more U.S. oil, gas and eventually advanced F-35 fighter jets.

title: Hamas says Trump's threats encourage Netanyahu to evade Gaza ceasefire deal
shortDescription: Trump demanded that Hamas "release all of the hostages now, not later," including the remains of dead hostages, "or it is OVER for you".

title: Second judge blocks Trump's sweeping freeze on federal funding
shortDescription: A federal judge on Thursday issued an injunction blocking the Trump administration from reissuing or adopting a funding freeze on grants and loans.

title: House censures Al Green for disrupting Trump during speech to Congress
shortDescription: The House voted on Thursday to censure Rep. Al Green, D-Texas., after his outburst during President Donald Trump’s address to Congress.

title: Trump plans to revoke legal status of Ukrainians who fled to US, sources say
shortDescription: The move, expected as soon as April, would be a stunning reversal of the welcome Ukrainians received under President Joe Biden's administration.

title: Trump allowed to fire federal employee watchdog, court rules
shortDescription: The legal saga started when Donald Trump on Feb 7 fired the person who prosecutes cases of illegal firings.

title: Trump issues new ultimatum to Hamas | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: President Trump agrees to temporarily exempt automobiles imported from Canada and Mexico from newly imposed tariffs.

title: Frustrated with party leadership, Democrats wonder what they can do to stop Trump
shortDescription: Congressional limitations hinder Democrats' pushback against the Trump administration, but constituents say more can be done.

title: Draft of Trump order seeks to dismantle Education Department
shortDescription: President Trump would direct Linda McMahon to "take all necessary steps to facilitate the closure" of the Education Department under a draft order.

title: Five ways Trump's Greenland saga could play out
shortDescription: Officials in Greenland and Denmark insist the world's largest island isn't for sale. Is President Donald Trump hearing them? Does it matter?

title: Impact of Trump's trans military ban
shortDescription: Some service members say the Trump administration’s ban on trans soldiers has had an impact on morale and community.

title: US judge bars Trump administration from cutting NIH research funding
shortDescription: A judge on Wednesday blocked President Donald Trump's administration from carrying out steep cuts to federal grant funding for medical research.

title: Trump demands Hamas release hostages or 'it is OVER for you'
shortDescription: "I am sending Israel everything it needs to finish the job, not a single Hamas member will be safe if you don’t do as I say," Trump said.

title: Mike Johnson's chief of staff arrested on DUI charge
shortDescription: House Speaker Mike Johnson’s chief of staff Hayden Haynes was arrested shortly after President Donald Trump’s speech to Congress on a DUI charge.

title: Trump pushes Congress to fund his immigration agenda 'without delay'
shortDescription: Trump is seeking money for detention beds and repatriation flights as it ramps up an effort to remove migrants who are in the country without legal permission.

title: Trump withholds US intelligence from Ukraine. Democrats are incensed.
shortDescription: CIA Director John Ratcliffe says pause is leverage against Ukrainian President Zelenskyy for peace talks but lawmakers say people could die as result.

title: Congress to inspect Guantanamo Bay amid migrant detention controversy
shortDescription: House Armed Services Committee members to inspect President Trump's migrant detention center as soon as Friday.

title: Trump grants US automakers a one-month reprieve on tariffs
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has agreed to exempt automobiles from newly imposed tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico for the next month.

title: Republicans want to censure Al Green after Trump speech
shortDescription: Republicans are launching efforts to censure Rep. Al Green, D-Texas., after his protest during President Donald Trump’s address to Congress.
